name: üöÄ S/4HANA Go-Live & Cutover
description: Critical resources and checklists for S/4HANA implementation go-live events and cutover activities

notes.title: S/4HANA Go-Live Checklist
notes.content:
=== Pre Go-Live (T-48 Hours) ===
‚òê Freeze all transport requests
‚òê Complete final data migration dry run
‚òê Backup production system
‚òê Verify cutover runbook reviewed by all teams
‚òê Confirm rollback procedures tested
‚òê Set up war room with technical & functional teams
‚òê Test emergency access procedures
‚òê Verify all interfaces are ready
‚òê Confirm batch job schedules
‚òê Review authorization matrix

=== Cutover Weekend (T-24 to T=0) ===
‚òê Start system downtime (legacy & S/4HANA)
‚òê Execute final data extraction from legacy
‚òê Run data transformation scripts
‚òê Load data into S/4HANA (LSMW/Migration Cockpit)
‚òê Execute reconciliation reports
‚òê Activate business configuration
‚òê Release critical transport requests
‚òê Execute post-migration validation scripts
‚òê Verify interfaces activated
‚òê Test user access (sample users per role)
‚òê Run smoke tests (order-to-cash, procure-to-pay)
‚òê Generate opening balance reports
‚òê Obtain business sign-off on data validation

=== Go-Live Day (T=0) ===
‚òê Announce system availability to users
‚òê Monitor SM21 (system log) continuously
‚òê Watch ST22 (ABAP dumps) for runtime errors
‚òê Check SM37 (background jobs) execution
‚òê Verify interfaces processing (SXI_MONITOR, SOST)
‚òê Monitor ST04 (database performance)
‚òê Track user login issues
‚òê Validate first business transactions
‚òê Confirm email notifications working
‚òê Review early warning system alerts

=== Post Go-Live (T+4 Hours) ===
‚òê Reconcile critical business processes
‚òê Validate financial postings
‚òê Check material master accuracy
‚òê Verify vendor/customer master data
‚òê Review interface logs for failures
‚òê Document all workarounds applied
‚òê Prepare status report for leadership

=== Hypercare Week 1 ===
‚òê Daily war room meetings (morning & evening)
‚òê 24/7 support coverage active
‚òê Track P1/P2 incidents to resolution
‚òê Monitor system performance metrics
‚òê Validate period-end readiness
‚òê Update end-user documentation
‚òê Conduct daily lessons learned sessions

notes.title: Critical T-Codes for Go-Live
notes.content:
=== System Monitoring ===
‚Ä¢ SM21 - System Log (check for errors/warnings)
‚Ä¢ ST22 - ABAP Dumps (runtime errors)
‚Ä¢ SM37 - Background Jobs (schedule & monitor)
‚Ä¢ SM50/SM66 - Work Process Overview
‚Ä¢ AL08 - Logged In Users
‚Ä¢ SM12 - Lock Entries (resolve locks)
‚Ä¢ SM13 - Update Records (failed updates)

=== Performance ===
‚Ä¢ ST03N - Workload Analysis
‚Ä¢ ST04 - Database Performance
‚Ä¢ ST06 - Operating System Monitor
‚Ä¢ ST07 - Application Monitor
‚Ä¢ SM59 - RFC Connections

=== Interfaces & Integration ===
‚Ä¢ SXI_MONITOR - PI/PO Interface Monitor
‚Ä¢ SOST - SAPconnect Send Status
‚Ä¢ SBWP - SAP Business Workplace (workflows)
‚Ä¢ SM58 - Transactional RFC (tRFC)
‚Ä¢ SMQ1/SMQ2 - qRFC Queues (outbound/inbound)

=== Master Data ===
‚Ä¢ MM01/02/03 - Material Master
‚Ä¢ XK01/02/03 - Vendor Master
‚Ä¢ XD01/02/03 - Customer Master
‚Ä¢ FS00 - G/L Account Master
‚Ä¢ PA30 - HR Master Data

=== Financial Close ===
‚Ä¢ FB01 - Post Document
‚Ä¢ FB03 - Display Document
‚Ä¢ F-43 - Vendor Invoice
‚Ä¢ F-28 - Customer Invoice
‚Ä¢ F110 - Automatic Payment Program
‚Ä¢ FBL1N/FBL3N/FBL5N - Vendor/GL/Customer Line Items

=== Transports ===
‚Ä¢ STMS - Transport Management System
‚Ä¢ SE01 - Transport Organizer
‚Ä¢ SE09 - Workbench Organizer

notes.title: Data Migration Validation
notes.content:
=== Pre-Migration Checks ===
‚òê Legacy data extraction complete
‚òê Data cleansing rules applied
‚òê Mapping tables validated
‚òê Test migration results reviewed
‚òê Delta migration approach confirmed

=== Master Data Validation ===

**Material Master (MM)**:
‚Ä¢ Count reconciliation (legacy vs S/4)
‚Ä¢ Key fields: Material number, type, plant
‚Ä¢ Pricing conditions mapped
‚Ä¢ MRP views activated
‚Ä¢ Storage locations assigned

**Vendor Master (LFA1/LFB1)**:
‚Ä¢ Count reconciliation
‚Ä¢ Payment terms mapped
‚Ä¢ Bank details validated
‚Ä¢ Tax codes assigned
‚Ä¢ Purchasing organization data

**Customer Master (KNA1/KNB1)**:
‚Ä¢ Count reconciliation
‚Ä¢ Credit limits transferred
‚Ä¢ Payment terms mapped
‚Ä¢ Sales area data complete

**G/L Accounts (SKA1/SKB1)**:
‚Ä¢ Chart of accounts complete
‚Ä¢ Account types correct
‚Ä¢ Financial statement versions
‚Ä¢ Cost elements activated

=== Transactional Data ===

**Open Items**:
‚Ä¢ AR open invoices reconciled
‚Ä¢ AP open invoices reconciled
‚Ä¢ Open sales orders transferred
‚Ä¢ Open purchase orders transferred
‚Ä¢ Open production orders

**Balances**:
‚Ä¢ Trial balance matches legacy
‚Ä¢ Inventory balances by plant/storage location
‚Ä¢ Asset balances (AA)
‚Ä¢ Work-in-progress (WIP) balances

=== Reconciliation Reports ===
1. Run legacy extract one final time
2. Run S/4HANA reports immediately post-load
3. Compare line-by-line
4. Document variances
5. Obtain business sign-off

notes.title: S/4HANA Go-Live Incident Response
notes.content:
=== Severity Definitions ===

**Priority 1 - System Down**
‚Ä¢ Response: Immediate (15 min)
‚Ä¢ Examples: System unavailable, database crash, authentication failure
‚Ä¢ Action: Activate SAP support immediately
‚Ä¢ Escalation: COO/CIO notification

**Priority 2 - Critical Function Down**
‚Ä¢ Response: 1 hour
‚Ä¢ Examples: Can't post financials, critical interface down, major performance degradation
‚Ä¢ Action: Engage technical lead + SAP support
‚Ä¢ Escalation: CFO/VP notification

**Priority 3 - Major Impact**
‚Ä¢ Response: 4 hours
‚Ä¢ Examples: Reports not working, minor interface delays, user access issues
‚Ä¢ Action: War room team troubleshooting
‚Ä¢ Escalation: Director level

**Priority 4 - Minor Issue**
‚Ä¢ Response: 8-24 hours
‚Ä¢ Examples: Cosmetic issues, enhancement requests, questions
‚Ä¢ Action: Log in backlog for post-hypercare

=== Common Issues & Quick Fixes ===

**Users Can't Login**:
1. Check SU01 - User locked?
2. Check SUIM - Authorization issues?
3. Check SM04 - Max sessions reached?
4. Check RZ10 - Profile parameters

**Background Jobs Failing**:
1. SM37 - Check job log
2. ST22 - Any dumps?
3. SM21 - System log errors?
4. Reschedule with corrected parameters

**Interface Not Processing**:
1. SXI_MONITOR - Message status?
2. SM59 - RFC connection active?
3. SMQ1/SMQ2 - Queue stuck?
4. SOST - Email/output issues?

**Performance Issues**:
1. ST03N - Workload spike?
2. ST04 - Database bottleneck?
3. ST06 - OS resources exhausted?
4. SM50 - Long-running work processes?

**Posting Errors**:
1. FB03 - Review error message
2. Check master data completeness
3. Verify period is open (OB52)
4. Check document type configuration

notes.title: Interface Monitoring Guide
notes.content:
=== Critical Interfaces ===

**Inbound (to S/4HANA)**:
‚Ä¢ Customer orders (EDI/API)
‚Ä¢ Vendor invoices (OCR/EDI)
‚Ä¢ Bank statements (SWIFT/BAI)
‚Ä¢ HR data feed (SuccessFactors/Workday)
‚Ä¢ Time & attendance data
‚Ä¢ 3rd party logistics (3PL) updates

**Outbound (from S/4HANA)**:
‚Ä¢ Order confirmations to customers
‚Ä¢ Purchase orders to vendors
‚Ä¢ Payment files to banks
‚Ä¢ Inventory data to warehouse
‚Ä¢ Financial data to BI/Analytics
‚Ä¢ Master data to external systems

=== Monitoring Points ===

**T-Code: SXI_MONITOR**
‚òê All messages processed (no errors)
‚òê Processing time within SLA
‚òê No stuck messages
‚òê Error queue empty

**T-Code: SOST**
‚òê Email notifications sending
‚òê Output requests processing
‚òê No red status messages

**T-Code: SMQ1/SMQ2**
‚òê qRFC queues processing
‚òê No SYSFAIL messages
‚òê Retry attempts reasonable

**T-Code: SM58**
‚òê tRFC calls successful
‚òê No hanging transactions

=== Troubleshooting Steps ===

**Interface Down**:
1. Check SXI_MONITOR for errors
2. Test RFC connection (SM59)
3. Verify credentials/certificates
4. Check network connectivity
5. Review partner system logs
6. Validate data format/schema

**Performance Issues**:
1. Check message volume spike
2. Review processing time trends
3. Check database performance
4. Verify batch sizes configured
5. Consider parallel processing

**Data Errors**:
1. Review error message details
2. Check mapping configuration
3. Validate master data exists
4. Test with sample payload
5. Engage interface developers

notes.title: Performance Baseline & KPIs
notes.content:
=== System Performance Targets ===

**Response Times (ST03N)**:
‚Ä¢ Dialog response: <1 second average
‚Ä¢ Background job: Within scheduled window
‚Ä¢ RFC calls: <500ms
‚Ä¢ Database reads: <10ms

**Resource Utilization (ST06)**:
‚Ä¢ CPU utilization: <70% average
‚Ä¢ Memory: <80% of allocated
‚Ä¢ Database size: Within capacity plan
‚Ä¢ Tablespace: <85% full

**Work Processes (SM50)**:
‚Ä¢ Dialog: <90% utilization
‚Ä¢ Background: Jobs completing on schedule
‚Ä¢ Update: No backlogs
‚Ä¢ Spool: Requests processing

=== Business Process KPIs ===

**Order-to-Cash**:
‚Ä¢ Order entry: <3 minutes
‚Ä¢ Credit check: Real-time
‚Ä¢ Delivery creation: <5 minutes
‚Ä¢ Invoice posting: <2 minutes
‚Ä¢ Payment processing: Same day

**Procure-to-Pay**:
‚Ä¢ PR creation: <2 minutes
‚Ä¢ PO creation: <3 minutes
‚Ä¢ Goods receipt: <5 minutes
‚Ä¢ Invoice verification: <3 minutes
‚Ä¢ Payment run: Within schedule

**Financial Close**:
‚Ä¢ Daily posting volume: 100% processed
‚Ä¢ Interface reconciliation: 100% match
‚Ä¢ Period-end close: Within 3 business days
‚Ä¢ Reporting: <30 seconds per report

=== Data Quality Metrics ===
‚Ä¢ Master data accuracy: >99%
‚Ä¢ Transaction posting success: >99.5%
‚Ä¢ Interface success rate: >99.9%
‚Ä¢ Reconciliation variance: <0.01%

=== User Adoption ===
‚Ä¢ Active users: 95%+ of total
‚Ä¢ Help desk tickets: <5% of users
‚Ä¢ Training completion: >90%
‚Ä¢ User satisfaction: >4/5

notes.title: Hot Community Posts - Go-Live Strategy
notes.content:
=== Top Post #1: S/4HANA Migration - Lessons Learned ===
üìå https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blogs-by-sap/s-4hana-migration-project-best-practices-and-lessons-learned/ba-p/13553891

**Why It's Essential**:
‚Ä¢ Real-world cutover runbook examples
‚Ä¢ Data migration pitfalls and solutions
‚Ä¢ Testing strategy that prevented go-live failures
‚Ä¢ Hypercare team structure and escalation paths
‚Ä¢ 3 dress rehearsal approach with timing details

**Key Takeaways**:
- Freeze code 2 weeks before cutover
- Practice cutover minimum 3 times
- Data validation must have business sign-off
- Monitor SM21/ST22 continuously first 48 hours
- Hypercare team 24/7 for 2 weeks minimum

=== Top Post #2: S/4HANA Clean Core Go-Live Governance ===
üìå https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blogs-by-sap/clean-core-governance-for-s-4hana-cloud/ba-p/13847920

**Why It's Essential**:
‚Ä¢ Clean Core principles applied to go-live
‚Ä¢ Change control board setup before cutover
‚Ä¢ Extension governance from day one
‚Ä¢ Master data ownership model
‚Ä¢ Release management post go-live

**Key Takeaways**:
- Establish governance BEFORE go-live (not after)
- Define clear extension vs configuration rules
- Assign master data stewards with accountability
- Implement change control process immediately
- Plan for continuous cloud releases post-launch

üí° **Pro Tip**: Both posts emphasize that go-live success = preparation + governance + hypercare structure, not just technical cutover execution.

notes.title: Hot Community Posts - Technical Deep Dives
notes.content:
=== Top Post #1: S/4HANA Performance Monitoring ===
üìå https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/monitoring-s-4hana-system-performance-best-practices/ba-p/13726548

**Why It's Essential**:
‚Ä¢ ST03N, ST04, ST06 monitoring playbook
‚Ä¢ Performance baselines for go-live
‚Ä¢ Early warning indicators
‚Ä¢ Work process optimization
‚Ä¢ Database performance tuning

**Key T-Codes Coverage**:
- ST03N: Response time analysis (<1 sec target)
- ST04: Database performance (buffer hit ratios)
- ST06: OS monitoring (CPU <70%, Memory <80%)
- SM50/SM66: Work process bottlenecks
- AL08: User session tracking

**Go-Live Specific**:
- Set performance baselines 1 week before
- Monitor continuously first 72 hours
- Alert thresholds: Response time >2 sec, CPU >80%, Memory >85%

=== Top Post #2: S/4HANA Interface Monitoring & Troubleshooting ===
üìå https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/s-4hana-integration-monitoring-best-practices/ba-p/13681293

**Why It's Essential**:
‚Ä¢ SXI_MONITOR complete guide
‚Ä¢ qRFC/tRFC troubleshooting (SMQ1/SMQ2, SM58)
‚Ä¢ IDoc monitoring and error handling
‚Ä¢ Real-time vs batch integration strategies
‚Ä¢ Performance tuning for high-volume interfaces

**Critical Monitoring Points**:
- SXI_MONITOR: Message processing status
- SOST: Email/output queue health
- SMQ1/SMQ2: Inbound/outbound qRFC queues
- SM58: Transactional RFC errors
- SM59: RFC connection testing

**Go-Live Checklist**:
- Test all interfaces in production-like volume
- Set up monitoring dashboards before cutover
- Document escalation path for interface failures
- Have rollback plan for each integration

üí° **Pro Tip**: These posts provide the technical foundation for the T-Codes in the go-live profile - read them to understand WHY you're monitoring these transactions.
